problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items with their dimensions

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment),
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure items fit within the box dimensions
        assert box_assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert box_assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Link box assignment to box id
        assert box_assignments[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i]

fit_items_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions, item_box_assignments)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap_constraints(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if box_assignments[i].box_id == box_assignments[j].box_id:
                # Check for non-overlapping conditions
                assert (
                    box_assignments[i].x >= box_assignments[j].x + items[j].width or
                    box_assignments[j].x >= box_assignments[i].x + items[i].width or
                    box_assignments[i].y >= box_assignments[j].y + items[j].height or
                    box_assignments[j].y >= box_assignments[i].y + items[i].height
                )

no_overlap_constraints(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def ensure_item_assignment_consistency(
    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert box_assignments[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i]

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)
full_formulation:
# --- Objects ---


Item = DSRecord({
    "width": DSInt(lb=1, ub=40),
    "height": DSInt(lb=1, ub=40)
})

BoxAssignment = DSRecord({
    "box_id": DSInt(lb=1, ub=20),
    "x": DSInt(lb=0, ub=40),
    "y": DSInt(lb=0, ub=40)
})



# --- Constants and Decision Variables ---
BOX_HEIGHT: int = 40
BOX_WIDTH: int = 40
ITEMS: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item) = [{"width": 27, "height": 34}, {"width": 19, "height": 18}, {"width": 11, "height": 4}, {"width": 34, "height": 35}, {"width": 26, "height": 26}, {"width": 7, "height": 7}, {"width": 7, "height": 21}, {"width": 35, "height": 19}, {"width": 5, "height": 29}, {"width": 17, "height": 27}, {"width": 11, "height": 31}, {"width": 5, "height": 2}, {"width": 30, "height": 17}, {"width": 24, "height": 27}, {"width": 7, "height": 28}, {"width": 9, "height": 27}, {"width": 4, "height": 9}, {"width": 11, "height": 4}, {"width": 26, "height": 21}, {"width": 21, "height": 9}]
N_ITEMS: int = 20
nr_used_boxes: DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)
item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
x_y_positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
N_ITEMS : int = 20
N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS : int = 20
N_X_Y_POSITIONS : int = 20


# --- objective ---
def calculate_objective(item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))) -> int:
    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        if item_box_assignments[i] > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = item_box_assignments[i]
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

def fit_items_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),

):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure item fits within the box dimensions
        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH

    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),

):

        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:

                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or

        assert positions[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert positions[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        # Ensure box_id in positions matches the assignment
        assert positions[i].box_id == assignments[i]

assign_items_to_boxes(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)

            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box
            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:
                # No overlap condition: rectangles do not overlap if one is completely to the left, right, above or below the other
                assert (
                    positions[i].x + items[i].width <= positions[j].x or
                    positions[j].x + items[j].width <= positions[i].x or
                    positions[i].y + items[i].height <= positions[j].y or
                    positions[j].y + items[j].height <= positions[i].y
                )

prevent_item_overlap(ITEMS, item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

constraints:
# -- Constraints --


# --- Auxiliary Variables ---
# Leave empty, if not required.
# --- constraints ---
def items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        item_width: int = items[i].width
        item_height: int = items[i].height
        assigned_box_width: int = BOX_WIDTH
        assigned_box_height: int = BOX_HEIGHT
        pos_x: int = assignments[i].x
        pos_y: int = assignments[i].y
        
        # Item must fit within the box dimensions
        assert pos_x + item_width <= assigned_box_width
        assert pos_y + item_height <= assigned_box_height
        assert pos_x >= 0
        assert pos_y >= 0

items_fit_exactly_in_boxes(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# Ensure consistent box_id between item_box_assignments and x_y_positions
for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
    assert x_y_positions[i].box_id == item_box_assignments[i]

# --- constraints ---
def no_overlap(
    items: DSList(length=20, elem_type=Item),
    assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):
            # Only check items in the same box
            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:
                # No overlap condition: rectangles do not overlap if one is to the left, right, above or below the other
                assert (assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= assignments[j].x) or \
                       (assignments[j].x + items[j].width <= assignments[i].x) or \
                       (assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= assignments[j].y) or \
                       (assignments[j].y + items[j].height <= assignments[i].y)

no_overlap(ITEMS, x_y_positions)

# Leave empty, if not required.

    item_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20)),
    positions: DSList(length=20, elem_type=BoxAssignment)
) -> None:
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        assert positions[i].box_id == item_assignments[i]

ensure_item_assignment_consistency(item_box_assignments, x_y_positions)

            if assignments[i].box_id == assignments[j].box_id:

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

        assert box_assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= box_width
        assert box_assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= box_height
        assert box_assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert box_assignments[i].y >= 0

            # Only check overlap if both items are in the same box

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

objective:

    max_box_id: int = 0
    for i in range(1, N_ITEM_BOX_ASSIGNMENTS + 1):
        box_id: int = item_box_assignments[i]
        if box_id > max_box_id:
            max_box_id = box_id
    return max_box_id

objective = calculate_objective(item_box_assignments)
nr_used_boxes = objective
minimize(objective)

        for j in range(i + 1, N_ITEMS + 1):

            if assignments[i] == assignments[j]:

problem_description:
Global problem:
    This problem involves a collection of items, where each have a value and a weight. We have different items given in the parameters.
    We have a infinite number of boxes with width BOX_WIDTH and height BOX_HEIGHT. All items need to be packed into minimal number of such boxes.
    The result and expected output is:
        - the assigment of each item into a box
        - the position (x and y) of each item within its assigned box. x and y have minimum values 0 and maximum infinity.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 1:
    The items that are put into a box, must fit exactly inside the box and must not stick out of the box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 2:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, they must not overlap.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

Sub problem definition - items that go in the bin - part 3:
    Taking the given items that are put into a box, one item can be exactly in one box.
    The result and expected output is the assignment of each item into a box and the position of each item within its assigned box.

constants.description: List of items to be placed in the box

decision_variables.description: Number of boxes used in the end to pack all all items. Minimizing it is the objective.
Which item is assigned to which box as a separate variable.
decision_variables.initialization: item_box_assignments: Annotated[list[Annotated[int, Field(strict=True, ge=1, le=20)]], Len(20, 20)]

decision_variables.description: Position x and y of each item within box as a separate variable.

    item_box_assignments: DSList(length=20, elem_type=DSInt(lb=1, ub=20))
):
    for i in range(1, N_ITEMS + 1):
        # Ensure assigned box ID matches the box assignment record
        assert item_box_assignments[i] == box_assignments[i].box_id
        
        # Ensure items fit within box dimensions
        assert box_assignments[i].x + items[i].width <= BOX_WIDTH
        assert box_assignments[i].y + items[i].height <= BOX_HEIGHT
        
        # Ensure positions are within valid bounds
        assert box_assignments[i].x >= 0
        assert box_assignments[i].y >= 0
        assert box_assignments[i].box_id >= 1
        assert box_assignments[i].box_id <= 20
